TypeSignature.Value: public abstract class EventInfo : System.Reflection.MemberInfo, System.Runtime.InteropServices._EventInfo
.class public sequential ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit EventInfo extends System.Reflection.MemberInfo implements class System.Runtime.InteropServices._EventInfo
Public MustInherit Class EventInfo Inherits MemberInfo Implements _EventInfo
public ref class EventInfo abstract : System::Reflection::MemberInfo, System::Runtime::InteropServices::_EventInfo

summary.span: 发现事件的属性并提供对事件元数据的访问权限。

span.span: Discovers the attributes of an event and provides access to event metadata.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 使用类检查事件并挂钩事件处理程序中的代码示例所示方法。Use the class to inspect events and to hook up event handlers, as shown in the example code for the method. > [!NOTE] > 不是要用于引发事件。 is not intended to be used to raise events. 一个对象由其内部状态指示引发事件。An object raises events as dictated by its internal state. 事件与委托一起使用。Events are used with delegates. 事件侦听器实例化无论引发的事件源，都会调用事件处理程序委托。An event listener instantiates an event-handler delegate that is invoked whenever the event is raised by an event source. 若要连接到事件源，事件侦听器将此委托添加到源上的调用列表。In order to connect to the event source, the event listener adds this delegate to the invocation list on the source. 当引发事件时，调用事件处理程序委托的 invoke 方法。When the event is raised, the invoke method of the event-handler delegate is called. 支持这两个多路广播和单路事件通知。Both multicast and single-cast event notifications are supported. `Add`和`Remove`方法，以及与事件相关联的事件处理程序委托类都必须在该元数据标记。The `Add` and `Remove` methods, as well as the event-handler delegate class associated with an event, must be marked in the metadata. 委托是面向对象的函数指针。Delegates are object-oriented function pointers. 在 C 或 c + + 中，函数指针是对方法的引用。In C or C++, a function pointer is a reference to a method. 委托与 C 或 c + + 函数指针，包含两个引用： 对一种方法还对支持该方法的对象的引用的引用。In contrast to the C or C++ function pointer, a delegate contains two references: a reference to a method and a reference to an object that supports the method. 委托可以调用一个方法，而不必知道类类型声明或继承的方法。Delegates can invoke a method without knowing the class type that declares or inherits the method. 委托只需知道该方法的返回类型和参数列表。Delegates need only know the return type and parameter list of the method. 事件模型适用于单强制转换和多路广播委托。The event model works equally well for single-cast and multicast delegates. 委托的调用时调用方法时，只有单个对象可以对它调用的方法。When the delegate's invoke method is called, only a single object will have a method called on it. 多路广播的修饰符可以应用于允许使用多个方法，该委托的 invoke 方法调用时要调用的委托声明中。A multicast modifier can be applied to a delegate declaration, which allows multiple methods to be called when the invoke method of the delegate is called. 调用上`EventInfo`时`inherit`参数`GetCustomAttributes`是`true`不会遍历的类型层次结构。Calling on `EventInfo` when the `inherit` parameter of `GetCustomAttributes` is `true` does not walk the type hierarchy. 使用继承自定义属性。Use to inherit custom attributes. ## Examples 下面的代码获取对象事件类。The following code gets an object for the event of the class. [!code-cpp[type_getevent1#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/type_getevent1/CPP/type_getevent1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[type_getevent1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/type_getevent1/CS/type_getevent1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[type_getevent1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/type_getevent1/VB/type_getevent1.vb#1)]

This type is thread safe.

Public Overridable Sub AddEventHandler (target As Object, handler As Delegate)
public: virtual void AddEventHandler(System::Object ^ target, Delegate ^ handler);

param.name: target
param.span: 事件源。

span.span: The event source.

param.name: handler
param.span: 封装当目标引发事件时要调用的方法。

span.span: Encapsulates a method or methods to be invoked when the event is raised by the target.

summary.span: 将事件处理程序添加到事件源。

span.span: Adds an event handler to an event source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法尝试将添加要同步目标对象上的事件的委托。This method attempts to add a delegate to synchronize the event on the target object. 每次引发事件时由目标参数的方法或处理程序封装的方法调用。Each time the event is raised by the target parameter, the method or methods encapsulated by the handler are invoked. 你可以使用`AddEventHander`方法时已编译的程序，不可以使用 + = 语法 C# 或 Visual Basic 时之后加载的类型`WithEvents`和`Handles`挂钩事件的关键字。You might use the `AddEventHander` method when you load a type after the program is already compiled, when it is not possible to use the C# += syntax or the Visual Basic `WithEvents` and `Handles` keywords to hook up the event. ## Examples 下面的示例创建的实例类，即可创建事件处理程序使用的动态程序集，并且动态事件处理程序挂钩。The following example creates an instance of the class, creates an event handler using a dynamic assembly, and hooks up the dynamic event handler. 使用后期绑定来执行所有操作。All actions are performed using late binding. 实例存储类型的变量在，和访问的所有代码执行因此后期绑定。The instance is stored in a variable of type , and all code that accesses the does so late-bound. 该示例使用方法以获取事件，和属性以获取个事件的委托类型。The example uses the method to get the event, and the property to get the delegate type for the event. 此示例获取为`Invoke`委托类型的方法，并获取从委托的签名实例。The example gets a for the `Invoke` method of the delegate type and obtains the signature of the delegate from the instance. 然后，示例创建动态程序集包含名为的单个类型的 1 个模块`Handler`和为该类型提供`static`方法 (`Shared`在 Visual Basic 中的方法) 名为`DynamicHandler`处理事件。The example then creates a dynamic assembly with one module containing a single type named `Handler` and gives the type a `static` method (`Shared` method in Visual Basic) named `DynamicHandler` that handles the event. 创建动态类型后，此示例将获取完成方法并使用它来创建委托实例。After the dynamic type is created, the example gets a for the finished method and uses it to create a delegate instance. 此实例传递给挂接事件的方法。This instance is passed to the method to hook up the event. 然后，程序暂停以允许引发事件。The program then pauses to allow the event to be raised. [!code-csharp[AddEventHandler#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/AddEventHandler/cs/source.cs)] [!code-vb[AddEventHandler#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/AddEventHandler/vb/source.vb)]

remarks.format: ## Examples 下面的示例使用属性来发现事件的委托类型并显示其参数类型。The following example uses the property to discover the delegate type of an event and to display its parameter types. 该示例定义了名为的委托`MyDelegate`以及一个名为的事件`ev`类型的`MyDelegate`。The example defines a delegate named `MyDelegate` and an event named `ev` of type `MyDelegate`. 中的代码`Main`方法发现通过获取该事件的委托类型的事件签名获取`Invoke`的委托类型，然后检索并显示参数的方法。The code in the `Main` method discovers the event signature by getting the delegate type of the event, getting the `Invoke` method of the delegate type, and then retrieving and displaying the parameters. [!code-cpp[eventarg#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/EventArg/CPP/eventarg.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[eventarg#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/EventArg/CS/eventarg.cs#1)] [!code-vb[eventarg#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/EventArg/VB/eventarg.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Reflection.MethodInfo[] GetOtherMethods ();
.method public hidebysig instance class System.Reflection.MethodInfo[] GetOtherMethods() cil managed
Public Function GetOtherMethods () As MethodInfo()
public: cli::array <System::Reflection::MethodInfo ^> ^ GetOtherMethods();

summary.span: 返回在元数据中使用 指令与事件相关联的公共方法。

span.span: Returns the public methods that have been associated with an event in metadata using the directive.

returns.span: 对象的数组，表示已在元数据中通过使用 指令与事件相关联的公共方法。

span.span: An array of objects representing the public methods that have been associated with the event in metadata by using the directive.

returns.span: 如果没有此类公共方法，则返回空数组。

span.span: If there are no such public methods, an empty array is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件的元数据可以将四种类型的方法与事件相关联：The metadata for an event can associate four kinds of methods with the event: - `.addon`指令指定用来添加事件处理程序的方法。The `.addon` directive specifies the method used to add event handlers. 使用方法来检索该方法。Use the method to retrieve an for that method. - `.removeon`指令指定用来分离事件处理程序的方法。The `.removeon` directive specifies the method used to detach event handlers. 使用方法来检索该方法。Use the method to retrieve an for that method. - `.fire`指令指定用来引发事件的方法。The `.fire` directive specifies the method used to raise the event. 使用方法来检索该方法。Use the method to retrieve an for that method. - `.other`指令指定与事件关联的任何其他方法。The `.other` directive specifies any other methods associated with the event. 使用方法来检索其中的数组这些方法的对象。Use the method to retrieve an array of objects for those methods. 与事件使用关联的方法`.other`指令具有对运行时没有特别的意义。The methods associated with an event using the `.other` directive have no special significance to the runtime. 不使用 C# 和 Visual Basic 编译器`.other`指令。The C# and Visual Basic compilers do not use the `.other` directive.

returns.span: 对象的数组，表示已通过在元数据中使用 指令与事件相关联的方法。

span.span: An array of objects representing methods that have been associated with an event in metadata by using the directive.

returns.span: 如果没有与该规范匹配的方法，则返回空数组。

span.span: If there are no methods matching the specification, an empty array is returned.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 事件的元数据可以将四种类型的方法与事件相关联：The metadata for an event can associate four kinds of methods with the event: - `.addon`指令指定用来添加事件处理程序的方法。The `.addon` directive specifies the method used to add event handlers. 使用方法来检索该方法。Use the method to retrieve an for that method. - `.removeon`指令指定用来分离事件处理程序的方法。The `.removeon` directive specifies the method used to detach event handlers. 使用方法来检索为此方法。Use the method to retrieve an for this method. - `.fire`指令指定用来引发事件的方法。The `.fire` directive specifies the method used to raise the event. 使用方法来检索为此方法。Use the method to retrieve an for this method. - `.other`指令指定与事件关联的任何其他方法。The `.other` directive specifies any other methods associated with the event. 使用方法来检索其中的数组这些方法的对象。Use the method to retrieve an array of objects for those methods. 与事件使用关联的方法`.other`指令具有对运行时没有特别的意义。The methods associated with an event using the `.other` directive have no special significance to the runtime. 不使用 C# 和 Visual Basic 编译器`.other`指令。The C# and Visual Basic compilers do not use the `.other` directive.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此属性确定事件的名称是否具有特殊含义。This property determines whether the event's name has a special meaning. 可能需要特殊处理的某些编译器的名称的示例的开头或包含下划线字符 (_)、 属性访问器和运算符重载方法的名称。Names that begin with or contain an underscore character (_), property accessors, and operator overloading methods are examples of names that might require special treatment by some compilers.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法尝试删除可能同步目标对象上的，此事件的委托。This method attempts to remove the delegate that may synchronize this event on the target object. 通过目标、 方法或通过封装的方法引发事件时`handler`不再将调用。When an event is raised by target, the method or methods encapsulated by `handler` will no longer be invoked.
